required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Visual Assessment of DAILIES® AquaComfort Plus® for Astigmatism as Compared to 1-DAY ACUVUE® MOIST® for Astigmatism
clinical_study.official_title: DAILIES® AquaComfort Plus® Toric - Comparative Assessment of Visual and Mechanical Performance

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate functional vision associated with rotational stability at blink of DAILIES® AquaComfort Plus® Toric (DACP T) compared to 1-DAY ACUVUE® MOIST® for Astigmatism (1DAM A).

primary_outcome.measure: High Contrast Time Controlled Visual Acuity (TCVA) at Day 10
primary_outcome.description: TCVA test was performed at 4 meters under high illumination (90%) using a Landolt ring test. For each acuity level, a series of single rings with gaps in one of four directions was presented and the percentage of correctly identified rings constituted the score. TCVA was measured in VA units and a higher TCVA value indicates an improvement in visual acuity. Both eyes contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lens Oscillation at Blink at Day 10
secondary_outcome.description: Lens oscillation (rotational stability of the lens on the eye) at blink was video-recorded. Digital images were used to measure the rotational characteristics of the lenses and objectively measure the amplitude of the lens oscillation. A higher value indicates greater lens movement on the eye. This outcome measure was collected at one site only.

arm_group.description: Nelfilcon A toric contact lenses worn first, with etafilcon A toric contact lenses worn second. Each product worn bilaterally on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.
Etafilcon A toric contact lenses worn first, with nelfilcon A toric contact lenses worn second. Each product worn bilaterally on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 1 study center located in the US and 1 study center located in the UK.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This reporting group includes all enrolled participants, as treated. Note: 2 participants randomized to DACP T were exited prior to dispense due to unacceptable fit (1) and unavailable lens power (1).

group.title: DACP T, Then 1DAM A
group.description: Nelfilcon A toric contact lenses worn first, with Etafilcon A toric contact lenses worn second. Each product worn bilaterally on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.

group.title: 1DAM A, Then DACP T
group.description: Etafilcon A toric contact lenses worn first, with Nelfilcon A toric contact lenses worn second. Each product worn bilaterally on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.

participants_list.participants: One participant completed Period 1 but did not start Period 2 due to unacceptable fit with DACP T.

baseline.population: This analysis group includes all randomized subjects who had no major protocol violations excluding those who met the critical deviation criteria as specified in the Deviations and Evaluability Plan.

group.title: Overall
group.description: Nelfilcon A and Etafilcon A toric contact lenses worn during Period 1 and Period 2, as randomized, in a crossover assignment.

outcome.title: High Contrast Time Controlled Visual Acuity (TCVA) at Day 10
outcome.description: TCVA test was performed at 4 meters under high illumination (90%) using a Landolt ring test. For each acuity level, a series of single rings with gaps in one of four directions was presented and the percentage of correctly identified rings constituted the score. TCVA was measured in VA units and a higher TCVA value indicates an improvement in visual acuity. Both eyes contributed to the analysis.
outcome.population: This analysis group includes all randomized subjects who had no major protocol violations excluding those who met the critical deviation criteria as specified in the Deviations and Evaluability Plan.

group.title: DACP T
group.description: Nelfilcon A toric contact lenses worn bilaterally during Period 1 or Period 2 on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.

group.title: 1DAM A
group.description: Etafilcon A toric contact lenses worn bilaterally during Period 1 or Period 2 on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.

measure.title: High Contrast Time Controlled Visual Acuity (TCVA) at Day 10
measure.description: TCVA test was performed at 4 meters under high illumination (90%) using a Landolt ring test. For each acuity level, a series of single rings with gaps in one of four directions was presented and the percentage of correctly identified rings constituted the score. TCVA was measured in VA units and a higher TCVA value indicates an improvement in visual acuity. Both eyes contributed to the analysis.
measure.population: This analysis group includes all randomized subjects who had no major protocol violations excluding those who met the critical deviation criteria as specified in the Deviations and Evaluability Plan.

outcome.title: Lens Oscillation at Blink at Day 10
outcome.description: Lens oscillation (rotational stability of the lens on the eye) at blink was video-recorded. Digital images were used to measure the rotational characteristics of the lenses and objectively measure the amplitude of the lens oscillation. A higher value indicates greater lens movement on the eye. This outcome measure was collected at one site only.
outcome.population: This analysis group includes all randomized subjects at the UK site with data at visit who had no major protocol violations excluding those who met the critical deviation criteria as specified in the Deviations and Evaluability Plan.

group.title: DACP T
group.description: Nelfilcon A toric contact lenses worn bilaterally during Period 1 or Period 2 on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.

group.title: 1DAM A
group.description: Etafilcon A toric contact lenses worn bilaterally during Period 1 or Period 2 on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.

measure.title: Lens Oscillation at Blink at Day 10
measure.description: Lens oscillation (rotational stability of the lens on the eye) at blink was video-recorded. Digital images were used to measure the rotational characteristics of the lenses and objectively measure the amplitude of the lens oscillation. A higher value indicates greater lens movement on the eye. This outcome measure was collected at one site only.
measure.population: This analysis group includes all randomized subjects at the UK site with data at visit who had no major protocol violations excluding those who met the critical deviation criteria as specified in the Deviations and Evaluability Plan.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected for the duration of the study (5 months). This analysis group includes all subjects exposed to investigational product based on treatment-specific exposure, as reported by the subject or observed by the investigator.
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence, unintended disease or injury, or untoward clinical signs in subjects whether or not related to the medical device. Note: 2 subjects were exposed to DACP T but not dispensed.

group.title: DACP T
group.description: Nelfilcon A toric contact lenses worn bilaterally on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.

group.title: 1DAM A
group.description: Etafilcon A toric contact lenses worn bilaterally on a daily wear, daily disposable basis for 10 days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Sr Global Brand Lead, GCRA, Vision Care
